item.title: MyDigitAlly
item.description:
Empowering Parents in the Digital Age #

Status: Active - Live platform with growing community

Visit MyDigitAlly → | Subscribe to Newsletter →

The Problem #

Parents today face an impossible challenge - guiding their children through a digital landscape they don’t fully understand themselves. The pace of technological change means even tech-savvy parents struggle to keep up with new platforms, risks, and opportunities.

Most resources are either:

  • Too technical for average parents
  • Too judgmental about parenting choices
  • Too time-consuming for busy schedules

The Solution #

MyDigitAlly converts research-based insights into accessible, 5-minute e-learning tools. We meet parents where they are - not where experts think they should be.

item.title: MyDigitAlly
item.description:
Empowering Parents in the Digital Age #

MyDigitAlly is a freemium edtech startup that helps non-tech parents confidently navigate their kids’ digital world.

The Problem #

Parents today face an impossible challenge: they need to guide their children through a digital landscape they don’t fully understand themselves. The pace of technological change means even tech-savvy parents struggle to keep up with new platforms, risks, and opportunities.

Most resources are either too technical, too judgmental, or too time-consuming for busy parents.

item.title: Digital Sovereignty Hardware Project
item.description:
Building Infrastructure for Digital Freedom #

Status: Early exploration - Public reveal planned for early 2026

The Vision #

In a world where our data is constantly extracted, analyzed, and monetized by corporations and governments, we’ve lost agency over our digital selves.

Current “privacy” solutions are bandaids on a fundamentally extractive system:

  • Browser privacy modes (still tracked)
  • VPNs (shift trust to another party)
  • Encrypted messaging (metadata still exposed)
  • “Privacy-focused” services (still controlled by companies)

This project explores hardware-based approaches to genuine digital autonomy - infrastructure that puts individuals back in control.

item.title: Stealth Hardware Project
item.description:
Digital Sovereignty for Everyone #

An early-stage hardware venture focused on true digital sovereignty - giving individuals complete ownership and control of their digital lives.

The Vision #

In a world where our data is constantly extracted, analyzed, and monetized by corporations and governments, we’ve lost agency over our digital selves. Current “privacy” solutions are bandaids on a fundamentally extractive system.

This project explores hardware-based approaches to genuine digital autonomy - infrastructure that puts individuals back in control.

item.title: Digital Sovereignty in an Uncertain World
item.description:
The Illusion of Control #

We live in a world of digital convenience, but recent events have exposed the fragility of the infrastructure that underpins our online lives. The massive AWS outage that took down a significant portion of the internet was a stark reminder that we’ve entrusted our digital existence to a handful of centralized platforms. When they fail, we’re left powerless.

This dependence creates an illusion of control. We believe our data is safe, our conversations are private, and our digital lives are our own. But the reality is, we’re building our digital homes on rented land, and the landlord can change the terms at any moment.

item.title: The Impossible Job of Digital Parenting
item.description:
The Knowledge Gap #

Parenting has always been challenging, but today’s parents face a unique and often overwhelming hurdle: the digital world. You’re expected to guide your children through a complex landscape of apps, games, and social platforms that are constantly changing, all while feeling like you’re several steps behind.

If you’ve ever felt lost, confused, or even a little scared when your child asks about a new app you’ve never heard of, you’re not alone. This isn’t a personal failing; it’s a systemic problem. The pace of technological change has created a “knowledge gap” between parents and their digitally native children, and it’s leaving parents feeling powerless.

item.title: About
item.description:
I’m a Portfolio Director, founder, and builder focused on creating tools that empower people in the digital age.

What I Do #

By Day: I lead product portfolios in agile delivery environments, focusing on prioritization, strategy, and rapid execution. My role centers on getting the right things delivered quickly - balancing stakeholder needs, technical constraints, and business goals.

By Night: I build ventures at the intersection of technology, education, and digital sovereignty:

item.title: Hareesh Kanchanepally
item.description:
Hareesh Kanchanepally #

Portfolio Director | Founder | Expert Generalist #

I lead technology portfolios and product development in agile environments, focusing on getting the right things delivered quickly. Outside work, I build tools that give people more agency in the digital world.

Currently building MyDigitAlly - an AI-powered platform helping parents navigate their kids’ digital lives with confidence. Also exploring hardware solutions for digital sovereignty (launching 2026).

item.title: Ventures
item.description:
I believe in building things that matter - tools that give people agency, knowledge, and sovereignty in the digital world.

Currently exploring two parallel paths: empowering parents through education (MyDigitAlly) and enabling digital sovereignty through hardware (stealth project).

item.title: What I'm Doing Now
item.description:
Last updated: November 2024

Current Focus #

Building MyDigitAlly #

Live edtech startup helping non-tech parents navigate their kids’ digital world with confidence. We’ve launched:

  • Weekly automated newsletter with research-based insights
  • 5-minute e-learning modules for busy parents
  • Custom AI assistant (in development) using RAG + MCP, grounded in our curriculum

Status: Active, growing community of parents

Visit MyDigitAlly →

Exploring Stealth Hardware Project #

Early-stage hardware venture focused on digital sovereignty and data ownership. Building the infrastructure for genuine digital autonomy.

item.title: Work
item.description:
Portfolio Management & Product Development Leadership #

I’ve spent 15+ years leading technology portfolios and product development across education, publishing, and digital transformation. My approach combines strategic portfolio management with hands-on product delivery - moving between 30,000-foot strategy and ground-level execution as needed.

What I Do #

Portfolio Leadership

  • Lead multi-year product roadmaps across concurrent initiatives (currently ~30 products)
  • Manage delivery of business-critical platforms serving millions of users
  • Drive integrated planning across product, engineering, architecture, and design teams
  • Oversee budgets up to £30M with track record of 100% on-budget delivery

Product Development
